Description: Body sherd of lid of Attic black-figured pottery vessel, probably a lekanis; interior: reserved near the centre, glazed to the outside with added red bands; exterior, from centre: band of rays; black-figure frieze with scene of wheeling chariot (heads of two youths, both with red hair and one wearing petasos, to right; upper part of trace horse's head with red mane and forelock, to right; ear and red forelock of frontal pole horse).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 343, no. B421)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0780) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 93, pl. II, no. 8)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
